publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8073 Ian McKee: Nursing Scotland’s Future—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal College of Nursing Scotland for its campaign for the Scottish Parliament election, Nursing Scotland’s Future; commends the principles on which the campaign is based, to manage money better, manage workforce better and make patient care better; notes the wide level of support that the campaign has gathered from members of the public, nurses, healthcare support workers, other healthcare professionals, MSPs and parliamentary candidates, and urges MSPs who have not yet signed up to the campaign to do so.

S3M-8073 Ian McKee: Nursing Scotland’s Future—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal College of Nursing Scotland for its campaign for the Scottish Parliament election, Nursing Scotland’s Future; commends the principles on which the campaign is based, to manage money better, manage workforce better and make patient care better; notes the wide level of support that the campaign has gathered from members of the public, nurses, healthcare support workers, other healthcare professionals, MSPs and parliamentary candidates, and urges MSPs who have not yet signed up to the campaign to do so. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-8073 Nursing Scotland’s Future (lodged on 3 March 2011) Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-8073 Nursing Scotland’s Future (lodged on 3 March 2011) Elaine Smith*, Linda Fabiani*
S3M-8073 Nursing Scotland’s Future (lodged on 3 March 2011) Dave Thompson*, Karen Whitefield*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Sandra White*, Mike Pringle*
S3M-8073 Nursing Scotland’s Future (lodged on 3 March 2011) James Kelly*, Mary Scanlon*, Rob Gibson*, Patricia Ferguson*, Rhona Brankin*, Aileen Campbell*
